summary:
The interface specialist and industrial designer presented their prototype to the team and discussed the features the prototype contained. In presenting the prototype, the issue arose that the prototype could only be used with the right hand. The team then looked at the production costs of the remote and found that their remote was actually under budget and that they could retain all the features they had originally decided upon without exceeding the target cost. The team evaluated the prototype on the basis of its look and feel, technological innovation, ease of use, costs, and its ability to be misplaced. Overall, the prototype performed very well in meeting all the criteria of the evaluation. The team then evaluated the project process, finding that they we
re happy with their product and their performance in the project.
problems: The need for separate right-handed and left-handed remotes.

From following the power point = slides we=20 discovered that we were to design, manufacture and market a remote = control=20 unit.

 

  

[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions = that were=20 made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of = high=20 importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

 

 It=20 was decided that we should consider a complex remote that controls = more than=20 one piece of equipment and that we should also consider a more simple = remote=20 that just controls one piece of equipment, for ease of = time. 

 

 

 

[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name=20 the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark = those that=20 you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write = fragmented=20 notes.

 Because=20 no one (myself especially) new what we were really doing before the = meeting=20 and how the meeting should have ran, time was not spent correctly or = very=20 productivly

  

 

 

[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that = each=20 member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented=20 notes.

 

I am=20 spending time filling out these questionaires instead of preparing for = the=20 next meeting, everyone is watching their computer screens awaiting=20 instructions from Big = Brother!

Then the user = interface designer gave a presentation on the different options for the = remote's looks: engineering design or simple. We are going for the = simple option. [ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role's perspective.


Catherine and I had worked on the final remote control design before our last meeting. We felt that we had come up with a very innovative design. It was ergonomically correct so as to avoid repetitive stress injuries among users. It used a smaller amount of buttons so that there was only basic, crucial functionality. It was made out of rubber and had kinetic power as an energy source. During the meeting the other two project members were very pleased with the design and had few comments or corrections. Rik mentioned that we would need a left-hand model.

ppt.content:
Kick-Off meeting
Presented by: , Project Manager
Agenda
Opening
Acquaintance
Tool training 
Project plan
Discussion
Closing (we have 25 minutes!)
Project Aim
New remote control
Original
Trendy
User friendly
Project Method
Functional design 
Individual work
Meeting
Conceptual design
Individual work
Meeting
Detailed design
Individual work
Meeting
Tool Training
Try out whiteboard!
Every participant should draw their favorite animal and sum up their favorite characteristics of that animal
Project Finance
Selling price: 25 euro
Profit aim: 50 M euro
Market range: international
Production costs: max. 12.50 euro
Discussion
Examples:
Experience with remote control
First ideas new remote
Etc.
Closing
Next meeting starts in 30 minutes
Individual actions
ID: the working design
UID: the technical functions design 
ME: the user requirements specification 
Specific instructions will be sent to you by your personal coach.

Components Design
Presented by: Catherine Canevet, Industrial Designer
RR Energy source
a basic battery 
a hand dynamo
a kinetic provision of energy 
use of solar cells
Cases
general case: uncurved (flat)
more original case: single curved 
or even double curved 
Case material supplements 
Plastic,
Latex (won't allow the use of solar cells as energy source), 
rubber (used in anti-RSI stress balls), 
wood, 
and titanium (can't use the titanium for the double curved cases)
Push buttons
scroll wheels with optional integrated push button (such as in the modern computer mouse), 
liquid crystal displays (LCD)
multiple scroll buttons
Note: if you use a rubber double curved case, you must use rubber push buttons. 
Electronics
Simple (push buttons), 
Regular (scroll wheel  higher price range),
advanced chip on print. The chip on print includes an infrared sender. (display, again more expensive)
RR have just developed a sample sensor/ sample speaker.

Working Design
Presented by: Catherine Canevet, Industrial Designer
Components
The idea: 
Infrared bulb
Bulb  
Switch  
Energy source 
Wire
Chip  
Subcomponent  
Energy source: 2 RL6 batteries.
Infrared bulb.

Interface Concept
Presented by: Gabriel, User Interface Designer
Method
Consulted our manufacturing division
Took Reissas marketing findings into consideration
Real Reaction has pioneered some new interface components that might be applicable to our remote
Some of these new interfaces have been used in other products, e.g. coffee machine
Findings
Speech recognition interface currently used with new RR coffee machine
Sample sensor/sample output
We could use spinning wheel w/ LC display as in iPod
We could consider a niche remote, geared either towards kids (e.g. bright colors, playful keys) or towards the elderly (e.g. giant and impossible to lose)
Findings, Continued
Key layout and design are crucial so that users arent always pressing the wrong key, e.g. up volume instead of down volume.
I neglected to mention that we need a power button
Personal Preferences
Speech recognition is quite limited, e.g. it only provides a verbal answer to a question
Rather than niche market, I think we should continue our plan of making a good general remote
No spinning wheel, LC display

Technical Functions Design
Presented by: Gabriel,  User Interface Designer
Method
Looked for inspiration from existing remotes
People will want something that is familiar
So we can take what is familiar and perfect that
Improve existing designs; maintain basic functionality
Findings
There are some basic functions that must be included:
Volume control
Numerical keys
Channel keys
Mute
Personal Preferences
There is a dichotomy of engineering-centered and user-centered remotes
The former provides a lot of functionality but the latter emphasizes ease of use
My preference is for the latter, i.e. centered on ease of use
Question for marketing guru: how much will this cost us in profits, or will it?

Evaluation criteria
Presented by: Reissa, Marketing Expert
Method
Evaluate each criteria on a scale of 1-7. 
1-true, 7-false.
Criteria's
Look and feel: Does the remote look cool and fashionable? Does it feel spongy?
New Technology
Easy to use
Cost
Amount of buttons: Contain only the necessary buttons.
RSI
Getting lost
Evaluation
Criteria rating with seven-point scale
Look at white board.

Functional Requirements
Presented by: Reissa Hainsworth, Market Expert
Method
Observed remote control users in a usability lab.
The participants were also asked to fill out questionnaires.
Total number of people tested was 100.
Findings
75% of users find the remote control ugly
80% of users would spend more money if the remote look fancy
Current remote controls do not match well the operating behaviour of the user
50% of users say that they only use 10% of the buttons on the remote.
75% users say they Zap
It takes to much time to learn how to use a new remote
Remotes often get lost in the room.
Personal Preferences
Easy to use especially for older people who find it difficult to learn new things.
Looks really cool/flash and groovy!!!!
Easy to find.

Trend Watching
Presented by: Marketing Expert
Method
From looking at this years trends and fashions.
And, from the recent investigation of the remote control market. 
Findings from remote control market.
Most important aspect: Looks and feels fancier that the existing remote controls.
Second important aspect: the Remote control should be Technologically innovative.
The third most important aspect: the remote control is easy to use.
Finding in the fashion industry.
Next years fashion: Fruit and vegetables are the most important theme for cloths shoes and furniture.
The feel of material  which is IN this year is SPONGY
Personal Preferences
Move away from the current remote controls look and feel.
Change the look and the feel while still keeping to the companies image.
